citation.article-title: Description of Thermoanaerobacter brockii subsp. lactiethylicus subsp. nov., isolated from a deep subsurface French oil well, a proposal to reclassify Thermoanaerobacter finnii as Thermoanaerobacter brockii subsp. finnii comb. nov., and an emended description of Thermoanaerobacter brockii.

p.s: Emendation of the species description of Thermoanaerobacter brockii Zeikus, Hegge, and Anderson 1979; Lee, Jain, Lee, Lowe, and Zeikus 1993.
Thermoanaerobacter brockii (brock'i.i. M. L. gen. n. brockii, of Brock, named for Thomas Dale Brock, who performed pioneering studies on the physiological ecology of extreme thermophiles)
Rods are 0.4 to 1.0 by 1 to 20 μm.
Cells occur singly, in pairs, in short chains, and in filaments.
Colonies are circular and 0.2 to 4 mm in diameter.
The optimum growth temperature is 55 to 70°C; the temperature range for growth is 35 to 85°C.
The end products of glucose fermentation are ethanol, lactate, acetate, H2, and CO2.
The G+C content of the DNA is 30 to 35 mol%.
Isolated from the sediment of lakes, hot springs, and oil wells.
